summary.intent: Add per-agent Skills rows and real logos for GitHub Copilot and Cursor in the Context tab, mirroring how Claude Code already surfaces skills.
summary.outcome: Successfully implemented all changes in ContextTab.tsx: skills split by path prefix, new Skills rows for Copilot/Cursor, CopilotLogo/CursorLogo components, separate SkillsBrowserModal instances, and updated section visibility. Tests and lint passed; committed to main.

repo: Skills are stored flat in a single array and distinguished by their `path` field (set by `getRelativePath()`), using prefixes: `.claude/skills/`, `.github/skills/`, `.cursor/skills/`
The project uses Biome for linting; ternary expressions must be kept on a single line to pass lint checks
Test and lint commands are `bun run test` and `bun run lint`; `bun run lint:fix` auto-fixes some issues
All Context tab UI is isolated in a single file: `frontend/src/components/ContextTab.tsx`

code.finding: Skills partitioning uses path prefix filtering: claudeSkills, copilotSkills, cursorSkills, genericSkills. Claude Code section combines claudeSkills + genericSkills.
hasCopilot and hasCursor visibility flags now account for skills presence in addition to instruction/rules counts.

workflow: When edits accumulate stale variable references (e.g., removed `skillsCount`), writing the complete corrected file with Write tool is cleaner than chaining multiple Edit operations
Biome lint errors on ternary formatting were caught post-edit and fixed with `bun run lint:fix` before final lint verification
The `rtk` prefix appears to be a shell alias/wrapper used in this repo for running commands

friction: Multiple Read passes were needed mid-implementation to track the current state of the file after sequential edits
Biome lint failed after initial implementation due to multi-line ternary expressions, requiring a follow-up fix pass
Stale variable reference (`skillsCount`) left over from incremental edits required rewriting the full file rather than targeted patches
open_items: The SVG logos for CopilotLogo and CursorLogo are described as approximate representations (robot-face, block-letter mark) rather than the exact official brand SVG paths â€” may want to replace with pixel-accurate official logos
No test coverage was added for the new Copilot/Cursor skills rows or modal states since this was UI-only; visual verification was deferred to manual browser testing
